thread.title: RSS say 'Kerala will be the next Kashmir' after BJP death
thread.title_full: RSS say 'Kerala will be the next Kashmir' after BJP death | Daily Mail Online

author: Mail Today Bureau
title: RSS say 'Kerala will be the next Kashmir' after BJP death
text:
RSS leader J Nandakumar
Days after the joint general secretary of RSS Dattatreya Hosabale threatened CPM rule in Kerala and led a dharna at Kerala Bhawan in New Delhi, another top functionary of the Sangh has alleged that the killing of a right-wing cadre in the state was sponsored by the LDF government in Kerala and that Kerala could be come the new Kashmir of India.
J Nandakumar, All-India Sah Prachar Pramukh of RSS, lambasted the LDF government led by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan at a brainstorming session organised by right leaning 'Group of Intellectuals and Academicians'.
'All over the world, communist rulers have had a single principle of rule: kill those in opposition. From Russia to Cambodia, China and Vietnam, lakhs of people were killed.
'Even in Kerala, the number of nationalists who have been killed so far has reached 300.
A top functionary of the Sangh has alleged that killings of the right-wing cadre in Kerala state was sponsored by the LDF government
'Kerala is also giving asylum to those associated with international Islamist terrorism and some of these have also been arrested. If adequate measures are not taken in time, the results could be akin to those in Kashmir,' said Nandakumar.
The senior RSS leader who comes from Kerala, also said that the state government's slogan of being the vanguard of the poor was completely hollow and alleged that communist leaders of the state, including chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan, had amassed immense riches.
'He (Vijayan) lives in a palatial house,' Nandakumar said. Writer Advaita Kala said that while the 'leftists raise a storm in Delhi over issues of human rights' while they 'play the butcher in Kerala.'
An annual rally by the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), a paramilitary volunteer nationalist organisation
